author: A_Brickset_user
title: Technic is for droids!
review:
Technic is the perfect place for maiking droids! This is a great looking droid, and because it looks so skeletal, it is a count! The blaster is good and the droid can reach back and pull it out of his "backpack" if need be! This one of my shorter reveiews but I cannot go into too much detail for technic sets! 
A shattering 10!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: one of the only technics that look like what there suppost to be.
review: As the title says this set looks almost right out of the movie. the only thing inaccurate is the blaster rifle is too small its the size of a large pistle not a large rifle. besides that the set was extrmly well put together.  except wen i built it i was like 10 so i really screwed up wen first tryin to build it. (in other words wen i tryed to fold it up it snaped in half.)

author: hustla187
title: Looks Like the Real Thing
review: Technic sets don't always look realistic but some sets like this one do. You get a really cool battle droid with a gun and moving arms. The gun looks very cool and doesn't want to be messed with. Lego did a good job on this set.

author: reidak49
title: roger roger
review: nice set it looks like a star wars battle droid it is skellatle looking a nice blaster its arms move and can grab its blaster but i in star wars these droid are not my favorite but this is differnt and it accurate

author: VideoGameLord613
title: "Useless things. A great danger to us than a Jedi."
review:
No, this is not a useless      ! It has high playability!
Features:
Fold up and Unfold feature for easier transport!
Can reach out of its backpack!
Has a small rifle!
Probably has no eyes!
This set is 13.7 inches tall.

author: thedent42
title: Free, but not cheap
review:
I was given this a few months back by a friend who was having a clear out, unfortunately not with box or full instructions, however regardless I downloaded the instructions and began with the build.

While my experience was somewhat unsettled due to a few missing pieces, the build itself was actually really fun, and made a great change from the usual non-technic star wars sets i'm used to building. One feature during this I really enjoyed was the inclusion of different colours for some of the elements, that allowed you to change the rank of the droid, which was a really great feature to include.

While I can't comment on the value for money,since I didn't have to pay for it, if you are able to pick one up then it is really worth it, as while it looks great as a display piece, the features such as being able to close up and reach for it's weapon are really nice and add an extra element to it that really bring it alive as a giant figure.

Overall opinion

While pieces wise there isn't anything particularly special, unless you count the magnets and the huge amount of tan technic elements, it is well worth getting as a display piece, even if the weapon isn't quite the right size for the film.

Pros: 

  • looks good, and very much resembles the one in the film
  • good play ability

Cons

  • not entirely movie accurate,
  • second hand elastic bands may need replacing, as they are under alot of strain when in standing position
